column4: Hey when I attempt to SCP or FTP into a specific folder on my server it's telling me "no such file or directory"
even though very clearly both the file and the directory exist
i can upload to the folder's immediate parent directory no problem btw
it's probably because the folder is owned by root
in ssh, go to that folder and do a ls -la and see who the owner is
you FTP in as your username... you ssh as root (which is highly unrecommended)... if your folder is owned by root you can't play around with it
the first bob is the user, the second bob is the group
no, you can skip sudo... but you should never log in as root... nasty things can happen
you can accidentally run a command that will screw up your whole system
sudo is the appropriate way to accomplish root commands
is this a web server?  because if you plan on having apache right to the server the group should be whatever group is set up for apache
